|Title=Photographs of breast skin lesions/anomalies
|Description=Bloody/lactescent discharge, flat spot, inflamed breast
|Rubric=Multimedia content
|Contributors=
|Order=7}}

[[File:SLIDE 2.jpg|vignette|Mammary asymmetry, left breast inflamed and edematous, orange peel appearance]]
[[File:Slide 3.jpg|vignette|Mammary retraction ("axe-like") opposite the 3 o'clock radius of the left breast]]

question.question: What is the typical presentation of breast skin lesions/anomalies?
question.option_a: A. Bloody discharge, redness, and swelling
question.option_b: B. Bloody discharge, redness, and swelling, with a flat spot
question.option_c: C. Bloody discharge, redness, and swelling, with a flat spot, and mammary asymmetry
question.option_d: D. Bloody discharge, redness, and swelling, with a flat spot, and inflamed breast
